<div class="section-label">Section · Structure</div>
<div class="section-title-strong">Suggested modules &amp; folders</div>

<p class="section-intro">
The exact layout of the repository is intentionally flexible. The structure below represents
a lightweight organisation that works well for both teaching exercises and rapid research
prototyping.
</p>

::: {.card-grid}

::: {.vbl-card}
<div class="pill-mini">RTM</div>

### `rtm/`

Basic radiative transfer examples using <strong>ToolsRTM</strong> and <strong>SCOPEinR</strong>,
including single-run scripts, parameter sweeps, and small lookup table (LUT) generators.
:::

::: {.vbl-card}
<div class="pill-mini">Traits</div>

### `traits/`

Scripts linking biochemical and structural plant traits (e.g. chlorophyll, LAI, water content)
to simulated spectra, vegetation indices, or SIF, including simple stress scenarios.
:::

::: {.vbl-card}
<div class="pill-mini">Time series</div>

### `time-series/`

Toy diurnal or seasonal simulations driven by changes in radiation, soil moisture, or
photosynthetic capacity, illustrating temporal dynamics.
:::

::: {.vbl-card}
<div class="pill-mini">Notebooks</div>

### `notebooks/`

R or Python notebooks used for interactive exploration, teaching demonstrations, and
quick checks of model behaviour.
:::

::: {.vbl-card}
<div class="pill-mini">Figures</div>

### `figures/`

Plots and diagrams generated by the lab, designed for reuse in lectures, presentations,
or scientific papers.
:::

::: {.vbl-card}
<div class="pill-mini">Docs</div>

### `docs/`

Short notes, mini-tutorials, and descriptions of example scripts or exercises intended
for students and new users.
:::

:::
